chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court calls cases 22CF146 and 22TR706.
Atty Hansen heard - Deft would like him to withdraw as counsel.
Deft would like to hire his own counsel.
Deft heard - has a meeting with an attorney in Appleton tomorrow.
Court speaks to Deft.
Deft requests Atty Hansen be withdrawn.
Court grants the motion and withdraws Atty Hansen.
Court schedules with parties.
3:35 PM
Status conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 03:10 pm.

Court calls the case - being heard on no contact order
Parents agree to have the no contact provision removed
ADA is being heard - agrees with lifting no contact provision
Atty Hansen agrees
Court grants - lifts no contact provision

records.addlTxt: Order for Defendant to Abstain From Alcohol and For Testing

10:03 AM Defendant Jacob Daniel Ryf appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Kathryn E Heineck in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls cases 22CF146 and 22tr706.
Court reviews charges and max penalties.
Court inquires on atty.
ADA heard on bond recommendations.
Deft heard.
Court imposes $500 cash bail w/ conditions; sign waiver of extradition, no possession or consumption of alcohol or controlled substances illegal in WI today without a valid Rx, no operating a motor vehicle without a valid license, no contact with L.S. or M.R., Compliance with Soberlink, not to be on the premises of any bars or taverns whose primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Court schedules with parties.
Deft to contact the Public Defender today.
10:07 AM
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Memo from DA - OWI is a 3rd offense
